results.name: a(n) = A082895(n)-A000203(n); the distance from sigma(n) to that multiple of n which is closest to sigma(n), positive terms for cases where the closest multiple is after sigma(n), and negative terms where it is before sigma(n). In case of ties, a positive term is selected.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
example: n=2: sigma(2)=3, the closest even numbers to 3 are 2 and 4, we choose 4 to get a positive difference, thus a(2) = 4-3 = 1.
n=28: sigma(28) = 56, thus a multiple of 28 which is closest to 28 is 28, so the difference is zero. Positions of zeros for this sequence is given by the multiply perfect numbers, A007691.
When n is a prime p > 2, sigma(p) = p+1, thus the multiple of p closest to p+1 is p, so difference is -1.
program: (PARI) A082901(n) = { my(s=sigma(n),  a = ((s\n)*n)-s, b = ((1+(s\n))*n)-s); if(b <= abs(a), b, a); }; \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 01 2018
